histogram.name: Chrome.AppMenu.MenuHostInitToNextFramePresented
histogram.summary: Records time from when Widget::Show() is called to when the first frame is presented for the App Menu. It's logged every time the app menu opens.

histogram.name: Chrome.BuildState.BuildStateUpdateType
histogram.summary: Result of polling for the installed version of Chrome. Logged once at startup then approximately every two hours.

histogram.name: Chrome.DWriteFontProxy.GetFontFailedHResult
histogram.summary: The HResult of failed GetFont calls in DWriteFontProxyImpl::GetFontFileHandles.

histogram.name: Chrome.DWriteFontProxy.GetFontFamilyFailedHResult
histogram.summary: The HResult of failed GetFontFamily calls in DWriteFontProxyImpl::GetFontFileHandles.

histogram.name: Chrome.DWriteFontProxy.InvokedIPC
histogram.summary: Records when an IPC is made to DwriteFontProxy. The bucket recorded is the IPC invoked.

histogram.name: Chrome.DWriteFontProxy.WinLastError
histogram.summary: The Windows last error obtained from a call to GetLastError after a failed attempt to obtain the file handle for a font.

histogram.name: Chrome.FontDataManager.NumMappedFiles
histogram.summary: Records the amount of currently mapped font files in a renderer's Font Data Manager. This is recorded whenever a new mapped file is added to the cache.

histogram.name: Chrome.FontDataService.CreateResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of creating the typeface result object in the browser process following a request for matching font name from a renderer process.

histogram.name: Chrome.FontDataService.EmptyPathOnGetFileHandle
histogram.summary: Records whether the font path is empty when attempting to obtain the file handle for a font.

histogram.name: Chrome.FontDataService.FileHandlePathReferencesParent
histogram.summary: Records whether the font path references a parent (contains "..") when trying to get a file handle to a font in FontDataService. This would prevent the creation of the base::File from succeeding.

histogram.name: Chrome.FontDataService.InvokedIPC
histogram.summary: Records when an IPC is made to FontDataService. The bucket recorded is the IPC invoked.

histogram.name: Chrome.FontDataService.MemoryMapCacheSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of the assets cache used when using a shared memory region. If the cache is over the size limit, a dump without crashing is triggered.

histogram.name: Chrome.FontDataService.WinLastError
histogram.summary: The Windows last error obtained from a call to GetLastError after a failed attempt to obtain the file handle for a font.

histogram.name: Chrome.Headless.Action
histogram.summary:
Records headless chrome action, e.g. remote debugging, screenshot, print to PDF, DOM dump. Reported once when the browser process is launched in headless mode. If more than one action is requested only one will be reported.
This histogram expired in December 2023 and was revived in M142.

histogram.name: Chrome.KAnonymityService.JoinSet.Action
histogram.summary: Track execution of KAnonymity Service JoinSet requests for both normal operation and errors. The kJoinSet enumeration is emitted when the service is called and either kJoinSetSuccess or one of the error enumerations is emitted at the end of the request.

histogram.name: Chrome.KAnonymityService.JoinSet.Latency
histogram.summary: Records the length of time the K-Anonymity service spends processing a JoinSet request. This includes time taking waiting in the JoinSet queue, getting a trust token (if necessary), performing the request, and waiting for the response. This metric is only measured for successful requests.

histogram.name: Chrome.KAnonymityService.QuerySet.Action
histogram.summary: Track execution of KAnonymity Service QuerySet requests for both normal operation and errors. The kQuerySet enumeration is emitted when the service is called and either kQuerySetsSuccess or one of the error enumerations is emitted at the end of the request.

histogram.name: Chrome.KAnonymityService.QuerySet.Latency
histogram.summary: Records the length of time the K-Anonymity service spends processing a QuerySet request. This includes time taking waiting in the QuerySet queue, formatting the request, performing the request, waiting for the response, and parsing the response. This metric is only measured for successful requests.

histogram.name: Chrome.KAnonymityService.QuerySet.Size
histogram.summary: Records the number of elements queried per call for each call to QuerySet.

histogram.name: Chrome.KAnonymityService.TrustTokenGetter.Action
histogram.summary: Track execution of KAnonymityTrustTokenGetter requests for both normal operation and errors. The kTryGetTrustTokenAndKey enumeration is emitted when the service is called and either kGetTrustTokenSuccess or one of the error enumerations is emitted at the end of the request. Note: This metric expired after M117 and before M121.

histogram.name: Chrome.KAnonymityService.TrustTokenGetter.Latency
histogram.summary: Records how the length of time the K-Anonymity service spends fetching trust tokens. This includes time taken waiting in the TrustTokenGetter queue, getting the OAuth token, getting the key commitment, and requesting the trust token. This metric is only measured for successful requests.

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.NotifyResult
histogram.summary: The result of every rendez-vous reported once per browser process launch.

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.RemoteHungProcessTerminateReason
histogram.summary: The reason of remote hang processes termination.

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.RemoteProcessInteractionResult
histogram.summary: Used to send the result of interaction with remote process as histograms in case when remote process influences on start.

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.TerminateProcessErrorCode.Posix
histogram.summary: The error code of remote process termination on Posix in case when remote process hung.

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.TerminateProcessErrorCode.Windows
histogram.summary: The error code of remote process termination on Windows in case when remote process hung.

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.TerminateProcessTime
histogram.summary: Time it takes from TerminateProcess call to the moment when we stop waiting for remote process switches to signal state.

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.TerminationWaitErrorCode.Windows
histogram.summary: The error code of wating for remote process termination on Windows.

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.TimeToCreate
histogram.summary: Time it takes to grab the process singleton. Reported once per successful attempt at obtaining the singleton.

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.TimeToFailure
histogram.summary: Time it takes to return an error from the process singleton algorithm (nor succeeding in obtaining it, nor in generating a rendez-vous). This does not include time spent in the fast notification path (chrome_exe_main_win.cc).

histogram.name: Chrome.ProcessSingleton.TimeToNotify
histogram.summary: Time it takes to find the process singleton owner and notify it. Reported once per successful rendez-vous. This does not include time spent in the fast notification path (chrome_exe_main_win.cc).

histogram.name: Chrome.SystemNetworkContextManager.NetworkSandboxEarlyLaunchCrashed
histogram.summary: Reported if the network service process crashed early in startup, before IPC and mojo services are available.

histogram.name: Chrome.SystemNetworkContextManager.NetworkSandboxLaunchFailed.ErrorCode
histogram.summary: The platform-specific error code returned from a failed attempt to launch the network service process sandboxed. This is recorded if an attempt is made to launch a sandboxed network service process, and the launch fails. See also ChildProcess.LaunchFailed.UtilityProcessErrorCode.

histogram.name: Chrome.SystemNetworkContextManager.NetworkSandboxLaunchFailed.WinLastError
histogram.summary: The Windows last error obtained from a call to GetLastError after a failed attempt to launch the network service process sandboxed. This is recorded if an attempt is made to launch a sandboxed network service process on Windows, and the launch fails. See also ChildProcess.LaunchFailed.WinLastError.

histogram.name: Chrome.SystemNetworkContextManager.NetworkSandboxState
histogram.summary: The operational state of the network sandbox. This is recorded each time the browser attempts to launch the network service process. This might be recorded multiple times from the same client if the network service process crashes or does not launch correctly. This is not recorded if the network service is running in-process.

histogram.name: Chrome.Tabs.AnimationSmoothness.HoverCard.FadeIn
histogram.summary: Tracks the animation smoothness for the fade-in animation of tab hover card.

histogram.name: Chrome.Tabs.AnimationSmoothness.HoverCard.FadeOut
histogram.summary: Tracks the animation smoothness for the fade-out animation of tab hover card.

histogram.name: Chrome.Tabs.AnimationSmoothness.TabLoading
histogram.summary: Tracks the animation smoothness of tab loading animation. A tracker starts when the first tab loading animation starts and stops after the last one stops for each browser window. The metric is emitted when the tracker stops.

histogram.name: Chrome.WrenchMenu.MenuButtonPressedToMenuShown
histogram.summary:
Records the latency from when the app menu button is pressed to when the menu is shown. It's logged every time the button is pressed.
This metric will be removed after M121 and is replaced by Chrome.AppMenu.MenuHostInitToNextFramePresented. We do not want to use menu button's compositor to track the app menu creation time.

histogram.name: Chrome.WrenchMenu.MenuHostInitToNextFramePresented
histogram.summary:
Records time from when the menu host initialization is started to when the next frame is successfully presented. It's logged every time the app menu opens.
This metric will be removed after M121 and is replaced by Chrome.AppMenu.MenuHostInitToNextFramePresented. We do not want to use menu button's compositor to track the app menu creation time.

histogram.name: ChromeColors.ColorOnLoad
histogram.summary:
Records installed color id every time theme service is initialized from prefs. Happens once per profile load if the user has a GM2 color installed.
This histogram records only GM2 colors. For tracking the installed GM3 color see the ChromeColors.DynamicColorOnLoad histogram. Or see the ChromeColors.ColorType histogram for the type of installed Chrome color.

histogram.name: ChromeColors.ColorType
histogram.summary:
Records installed color type every time theme service is initialized from prefs. Happens once per profile load if the user has a Chrome color installed.
To track, which color is installed see the ChromeColors.ColorOnLoad histogram for GM2 colors and the ChromeColors.DynamicColorOnLoad histogram for GM3 colors.

histogram.name: ChromeColors.DynamicColorOnLoad
histogram.summary:
Records installed color id every time theme service is initialized from prefs. Happens once per profile load if the user has a GM3 color installed.
This histogram records only GM3 colors. For tracking the installed GM2 color see the ChromeColors.ColorOnLoad histogram. Or see the ChromeColors.ColorType histogram for the type of installed Chrome color.

histogram.name: ChromeElf.ApplyHookResult
histogram.summary: Records the NTSTATUS result that was returned when attempting to hook NtMapViewOfSection during chrome_elf.dll initialization. Emitted asynchronously shortly after startup. This histogram was expired between M82 and M114.

histogram.name: ChromeElf.Beacon.RetryAttemptsBeforeSuccess
histogram.summary: Records the number of attempts needed before third-party DLL blocking was properly set up. This is logged immediately after a successful setup. Only recorded on Windows. This histogram was expired between M82 and M114.

histogram.name: ChromeElf.Beacon.SetupStatus
histogram.summary: Records the successes and failures when running the third-party DLL blocking setup code, taking into account the safety beacon. Used to determine how often the third-party DLL blocking is disabled because it failed to initialize properly twice in a row. Only recorded on Windows. This histogram was expired between M82 and M114.

histogram.name: ChromeElf.ExtensionPoint.EnableState
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of the heuristic to selectively enable or disable the ProcessExtensionPointDisablePolicy. Used to determine how often the policy will be enabled in practice, as the heuristic detects the presence of third party software. Only recorded on Windows. This histogram was expired between M93 and M114.
